issues: Major coordinate discrepancy: 149.79 km distance between asserted coordinates (43.0995, -89.4045) and geocoded location from geo_loc_name (44.4308975, -89.6884637)
Low land cover-soil consistency: Aquatic sample shows 'Luvisols' soil type which is terrestrial, inconsistent with lake water environment
Asserted coordinates point to Lake Mendota specifically, but geo_loc_name 'USA: Wisconsin' is too broad and geocodes to state center
Environmental features lookup found no water features within 1000m of asserted coordinates, raising questions about coordinate accuracy
Soil type classification inappropriate for aquatic sample - should be sediment classification instead
recommendations: Verify and correct coordinate accuracy - asserted coordinates (43.0995, -89.4045) appear to be correct for Lake Mendota, but geo_loc_name should be more specific
Update geo_loc_name to 'USA: Wisconsin, Lake Mendota' or 'USA: Wisconsin, Madison' to better match coordinates
Replace soil type classification with lake sediment or bottom substrate classification appropriate for aquatic environments
Consider adding water body identifier or lake-specific metadata fields
Validate coordinate precision against known Lake Mendota boundaries
Review environmental feature detection methodology for aquatic sampling sites
